content:
Here are some additional SQL queries that you might use to manage data in a comprehensive leave management system:

* To insert a new employee into the `employees` table:
```
INSERT INTO employees (first_name, last_name, email, manager_id)
VALUES ('John', 'Doe', 'john.doe@example.com', 1);
```
* To update the email address for an employee:
```
UPDATE employees
SET email = 'john.doe@newcompany.com'
WHERE id = 1;
```
* To delete an employee from the `employees` table:
```
DELETE FROM employees WHERE id = 1;
```
* To retrieve a list of all employees who report to a specific manager:
```
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE manager_id = 1;
```
* To retrieve a list of all leave requests that have a status of "pending":
```
SELECT * FROM leave_requests WHERE status = 'pending';
```
* To retrieve the leave balance for a specific employee:
```
SELECT balance FROM leave_balances WHERE employee_id = 1;
```
These are just a few examples of the types of SQL queries that you might use in a comprehensive leave management system. The specific queries that you will need will depend on the requirements and functionality of your system.
